content.description: Work the obvious jug-lined seam. After a few moves, go straight up on jugs and slopers to top out.Again, another one where you should bring your brush and contribute a little scrubbing when you come until it's clean as can be.
content.location: The first problem on the left side of the roof. North corner of the boulder. Start as far back as the boulder at the base allows.

content.description: A unique, contorted problem. Start matched on the same jug as for "Spruce it Up" but then head out right through the roof-dihedral feature. Pull the lip at the end.
content.location: This is the right hand line on the large roof.

content.description: A long compression line out a steep roof. A rarity for the area. SDS back and right on an obvious starting jug. Follow crimps leftward to the center belly of the roof. Slap and squeeze on worsening holds. Once the jug is reached it should be over. Continue straight up to top out.
content.protection: 4 to 5 pads is nice, and/or spotters to move pads
content.location: Problem is found on downhill side of block, start begins in the way back of the roof. Down climb back side.

content.description: Crouch start on two large sloping holds. Work some sizable crimps and edges to the right before making a large move up and left to finish the boulder.Doubles as a nice warm up for harder problems on the boulder.Bring a brush and help make this fun problem a bit cleaner!
content.location: Start on two large sloping holds on the Northeast face of the boulder.

content.description: Short and powerful. SDS matched on two poor holds. Sustained difficulty for four moves then a toss to the slopey lip. Mantle over. Some of the holds bite.
content.location: On the boulder's uphill side is a clean 40 degree wall. This is the left line on that wall.

content.description: Start on the lowest crimp rails, practically laying down. Move up to two decent crimps and then make the long crux deadpoint to a rounded edge. Finish the same as Rough Sawn. Reachy.
content.protection: Few pads. Sloped landing. Spotters not really needed.
content.location: Line of crimps on the right side of the 30 degree wall.

content.description: Steep block with some hard problems and a couple easy ones. Sheltered spot in the forest and not much further of a hike past the main area. Probably has some history that I'm sure someone will chime in with.
